alert.note: Alert for Inland Volusia; Orange; Osceola; Seminole (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 30 at 7:55AM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Seminole, southeastern Orange and northern Osceola Counties through 830 AM EDT... At 755 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Avalon Park, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Orlando, Kissimmee, Oviedo, Saint Cloud and Wedgefield. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. These types of funnel clouds are harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 PM EDT for east central Florida.
